column5: Railway Station Interchange, Station Road, Corby, NN17 1NA
column11: owned by a public authority
column16: Site was previously subject to a Starter Homes bid to the HCA.
column26:
Site previously assessed through SHLAA as site 2030.

The site has been subject to a bid to the HCA for Starter Homes funding and it was assumed that 40 dwellings could be delivered on the site. However, as part of an urban design review, consideration was also made of a mix of uses being deployed on site which reduces the developable area for housing (assuming 50dph) an alternative yield of 29 dwellings has been assumed.

column5: Parkland Gateway, George Street, Corby, NN17 1QG
column11: owned by a public authority
column26:
Site previously assessed through SHLAA as site 2037.

The site was previously been subject to a bid to the HCA for Starter Homes funding and it was assumed that 40 dwellings could be delivered on the site. However, as part of an urban design review, consideration was also made of higher densities (flats) being deployed on site and assuming 100dph an alternative yield of 63 dwellings has been assumed.

column5: Scott Road Garages, Scott Road, Kettering, NN16 9JY
column11: owned by a public authority
column16: At Planning Policy Committee on 05.09.17 it was agreed to designate this site as a draft housing allocation in the draft Part 2 Local plan for consultation with a potential yield of 25 dwellings. Potential housing allocation in Kettering Borough Council's Part 2 Local Plan. This site was included in the Draft Plan when it went to consultation in Summer 2018. Since this time a planning application (KET/2018/0799) for 22 dwellings has been received.  The target decision date for this application is 23rd January 2019 .                                                        .  https://www.kettering.gov.uk/planningApplication/128345
column25: A sewer easement crosses the site.
column26:
Previously assessed through SHLAA as site 705.

Council owned site. Preference would be for affordable housing on site.

Different dwelling capaciites have been calculated for the site dependent on potential densities to be applied (taking account of the surrounding area). These entail either 17 houses at 50dph or 12 houses at 35 dph and these values take account (exclude) an area of the site under which a sewer easement runs.

column5: Kettering Football Club, Rockingham Road, Kettering, NN16 9EU
column11: not owned by a public authority
column16: At Planning Policy Committee on 05.09.17 it was agreed to designate this site as a draft housing allocation in the draft Part 2 Local plan for consultation with a potential yield of 88 dwellings. An application of Prior Nofication of Demolition has been received for the site, (ref. KET/2017/0761) and this has been since undertaken.  This site was included in the Draft Plan when it went to consultation in Summer 2018. Since this time a planning application for 49 dwellings (KET/2018/0519)  has been received. The target decision date for this application is 21st December 2018.  https://www.kettering.gov.uk/planningApplication/128083

column5: Desborough Leisure Centre, Off Broadlands, Desborough, NN14 2YH
column11: owned by a public authority
column16:
Former Leisure Centre has been demolished. Site has been subject to an application for 304 dwellings (KET/2016/0044) albeit this was refused on 26/05/2016. An appeal was  lodged to this decision and the appeal was allowed granting outline planning permission on the site (APP/L2820/W/16/3162430). This site forms part of the planning application site, which extends further westwards towards Rothwell Road. 

Details are available here: https://www.kettering.gov.uk/planningApplication/122648
column19: KET/2016/0044 - Residential development up to 304 dwellings - Outline. Appeal allowed. (APP/L2820/W/16/3162430)
column25:
Previously assessed through SHLAA as site 1165.

http://www.nnjpu.org.uk/publications/docdetail.asp?docid=1323
column26: For BFR assessment purposes it is assumed that development will only happen on the PDL element of site (and not the larger, wider site which includes extensive tracts of Greenfield). To derive these estimates it has been calculated that only 30% of the wider site is PDL so 70% of the overall site has been discounted for development, hence the minimum figure propsed of 46 net dwellings used.

column5: Rockingham Dene, Rockingham Road, Kettering, NN16 9JW
column11: owned by a public authority
column16:
Outline consent for 9 dwellings exists on the land adjacent to this site (KET/2015/0220) but BFR K30 itself has no extant permission. Approval of reserved matters on the same land was approved 08/06/2018 (KET/2018/0257).

Site was previously occupied by a Children's Care Home which closed in July 2002 and was demolished thereafter. 

Site was subject to a previous application for 28 dwellings (KET/2007/0990) which Committee resolved to grant permission for (subject to S.106) albeit this was never completed and the application was disposed of by the Council in September 2012.

Details are available here:  https://www.kettering.gov.uk/planningApplication/127806
column25: Tree Preservation Orders exist on the site (TPO 2008 No6).

Development here would support Town centre regeneration. 
The site is a long term site allocation in both the Adopted TCAAP and in the emerging Plan for the Borough of Wellingborough as Policy site TC9.
column26: Allocated as Site C in the 2009 Wellingborough Town Centre Area Action Plan          Allocated as policy site TC9 in the Plan for the Borough of Wellingborough which is aiming to be adopted by the council in February 2019.

WP/15/00094/FUL
WP/16/00682/FUL

http://bit.ly/2rl6MY7
column19:
WP/15/0092/FUL - Erection of a terrace of five 2-storey houses with room in the roof and associated works. 

WP/15/00094/FUL - Conversion of upper floor to 5 self-contained residential units and the change of use of ground floor from D2 use class to D1 use class (non-residential Community Centre). Associated external alterations to the building. 

WP/16/00682/FUL  - Conversion of ground and lower floors of former Working Mens Club to form four two-bed and one one-bed flats. ADDITIONAL BIN STORAGE (this permission partially supersedes 
WP/15/00094/FUL)
column25:
The five dwelling units pursuant to WP/15/00092/FUL were completed in June 2016 and are located at the rear of the working mens club. 

The 5 self-contained residential units pursuant to WP/15/00094/FUL were completed in September 2016.

Works relating to WP/16/00682/FUL commenced in August 2017.
